intro: Boechera peirsonii, commonly known as the Sierra Point Peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This low-growing perennial has small, rounded leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. The plant is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands.
